Midlands Regional Network Seminar Series </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;ea397cce.1503</link>   <description> Please see the attached flyer for the upcoming seminar entitled 'Futures of Imprisonment to be held on 6th May 2015 in Room B63 Law and Social Sciences Building, University Park Campus, University of Nottingham   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T10:59:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;ea397cce.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;a6df6951.1503</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Please note the last seminar for this year will be taking place on 6th May 2015<br>Room B63 Law and Social Sciences Building, University Park Campus, University of Nottingham entitled: Futures of Imprisonment<br><br>I look forward to seeing you there,<br><br>Azrini<br><br>Professor Azrini Wahidin<br>Chair of the BSC Midlands Regional Network<br>Nottingham Trent University<br><br>British Society of Criminology Midlands Regional Network Seminar Series [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-05T10:41:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Azrini Wahidin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;a6df6951.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;73ac0a59.1503">   <title>The Crime Drop in England and Wales: Further Evidence' Loughborough University, Department of Social Sciences . Wednesday 4th March 2015 4-6pm </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;73ac0a59.1503</link>   <description> Dear all,<br>Please note the the 3rd seminar in the BSC Regional series is on the horizon. Do make a note of the date, time and venue.<br><br>Best<br><br>Azrini   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T09:49:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;73ac0a59.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;b7c6b8d8.1502">   <title>Professor Bill Dixon's Inaugural Lecture Wednesday 25th February. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;b7c6b8d8.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>I would like to remind you that Professor Bill Dixon's Inaugural Lecture is taking place tomorrow evening. The title of the talk is entitled: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSouth Africa: a country unhinged\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, in Room B62 in the Law and Social Sciences Building on the University Park Campus at the University of Nottingham from 5.00 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 6.30 pm on Wednesday 25th February. For more information contact Rebecca Swift (Rebecca.swift@nottingham.ac.uk). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T18:23:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Azrini Wahidin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;b7c6b8d8.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;7b0473b2.1502">   <title>Final Call - ESRC/NWDTC PhD Studentship </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;7b0473b2.1502</link>   <description> FINAL CALL - CLOSING DATE FEBRUARY 20, 2015<br>Fully funded ESRC/NWDTC PhD Studentship<br><br>Department of Sociology, Social Policy and Criminology, School of Law and Social Justice, The University of Liverpool<br><br>in partnership with<br><br>Her Majesty\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Inspectorate of Prisons<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdExploring Pathways and Transitions between Juvenile and Adult Penal Institutions\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Full details available at: http://www.jobs.ac.uk/job/AKK858/phd-case-3-studentship-exploring-pathways-and-transitions-between-juvenile-and-adult-penal-institutions/   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T12:01:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;7b0473b2.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;22403b41.1502">   <title>Inaugural Lecture </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;22403b41.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>I would like to invite you to my Inaugural Lecture, 'South Africa: a country unhinged', which is taking place in Room B62 in the Law and Social Sciences Building on the University Park Campus at the University of Nottingham from 5.00 - 6.30 pm on Wednesday 25th February. For more information and to let us know that you will be attending for catering purposes (light refreshments only, I'm afraid), please contact Rebecca Swift (Rebecca.swift@nottingham.ac.uk&lt;mailto:Rebecca.swift@nottingham.ac.uk&gt;). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T17:03:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>William Dixon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;22403b41.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;2c78b16.1501">   <title>BSC Midlands Regional Network upcoming events </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;2c78b16.1501</link>   <description> Sent on behalf of Professor Azrini Wahidin:<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>I writing to you all as Chair of the BSC Midlands Regional Network, to inform you of two exciting events in March and May of this year.<br><br>Looking forward to seeing you,<br><br>Professor Azrini Wahidin<br><br>Loughborough University<br>Title: The Crime Drop in England and Wales: Further Evidence<br>Wednesday 4th March 2015 4-6pm, Room U122, Brockington Building [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-14T09:37:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;2c78b16.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;3a94c76f.1501">   <title>BSC Victims Network Conference 28/1/15 Lincoln </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;3a94c76f.1501</link>   <description> At the July 2014 annual conference of the British Society of Criminology, the first meeting of the newly constituted specialist BSC Victims Network took place.<br><br>This first Network research day conference will take place on 28th January 2015 at the School of Law at the University of Lincoln. Entitled \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFuture Directions in Victimology\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd the conference will bring together established experts in victimological research with new entrants to the field (including PGRs and ECRs) to foster collaborative outputs which will help drive the development of contemporary victimology in the UK and further afield. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-13T18:46:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;3a94c76f.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;f9263063.1501">   <title>Invitation to End of Project Conference (Re: Which burglary devices work for whom and in what context?) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;f9263063.1501</link>   <description> This is a follow up to our previous invitation to the to the end of project \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdWhich burglary devices work for whom and in what context?\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, day conference at the Galleries of Justice Museum, Nottingham, Wednesday 21st January 2015, 9.30-15.30.<br><br>The conference aims to bring together academics, representatives of the national and local government, crime prevention professionals and the building and insurance industry to hear about and discuss: (a) the effectiveness of security devices; (b) which population groups and areas of England and Wales experienced less than average burglary falls due to lack of effective home security and how to [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-13T16:50:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;f9263063.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;affe437b.1501">   <title>Research Vacancy at University Leicester </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;affe437b.1501</link>   <description> Members may like to flag up this vacancy to colleagues/research students.<br><br>This might prove to be an excellent opportunity for someone you know.<br><br>Research Associate in Criminology (University of Leicester)<br><br>Fixed term until September 2016. Full-time. Salary Grade 7: \ufffd\ufffd32,277. Full details here:<br><br>http://www.jobs.ac.uk/job/ATS199/research-associate-in-criminology/<br><br>Closes: 15th January 2015   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-04T14:04:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Philip Wane</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;affe437b.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;8c176161.1412">   <title>MIDLANDS REGIONAL NETWORK - SAVE THESE DATES IN YOUR DIARY </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;8c176161.1412</link>   <description> MIDLANDS REGIONAL NETWORK - SAVE THESE DATES IN YOUR DIARY<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThe Crime Drop in England and Wales: Further Evidence\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd - Wednesday 4th March 2015: 4-6pm, Room U122, Brockington Building. Loughborough University.<br><br>'Futures of Imprisonment' - Wednesday 6th May 2015: 6.00 - 8.00 pm, Room B63 in the Law and Social Sciences Building on the University Park Campus at the University of Nottingham. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-17T09:46:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;8c176161.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;75183ec1.1412">   <title>Dates for Diaries - BSC Midlands Branch 2015 events </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;75183ec1.1412</link>   <description> BSC Midlands Branch<br>Theme: Crime drop<br>4-6pm 4th March 2015, Loughborough University<br>Speakers:<br>Professor Sylvia Walby OBE, Lancaster University<br>Professor Stephen Farrall, University of Sheffield<br>Professor Nick Tilley, University College London<br>Contact: Professor Andromachi Tseloni: a.tseloni@lboro.ac.uk<br><br>Theme: Futures of Imprisonment<br>6pm \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 8pm May 2015, Nottingham University<br>Date and Room: to be confirmed<br>Speakers:<br>Professor Dirk van Zyl Smit,<br>Dr Evi Girling<br>Dr Melanie Jordan<br>Contact: Professor Bill Dixon: William.Dixon@nottingham.ac.uk   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-02T12:28:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;75183ec1.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;38279aef.1411">   <title>BSC Midlands Regional Network event - 26/11/14 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;38279aef.1411</link>   <description> The next BSC Midlands Regional Network will be on 26th November 2014, 6-8pm and will be examining the theme 'Policing in the 21st Century' with guest speakers Roger Baker (Visiting Professor of Policing at the University of Derby and former HMI), Dr Rob Mawby (Reader in the Department of Criminology at the University of Leicester) and Nick Howe (Senior Lecturer in Criminology at the University of Derby and former Police Chief Superintendent with Staffordshire Police). For further details contact Dr. Phil Hodgson p.hodgson@derby.ac.uk or go to http://www.derby.ac.uk/lhss/news-and-events/events/bsc-midlands-network-event/   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-12T10:15:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Linda Asquith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;38279aef.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;2d3c3763.1410">   <title>Launch Event </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;2d3c3763.1410</link>   <description> Launch of the British Society of Criminology Midlands Regional Network: Gender, Crime and Justice<br><br>Looking forward to meeting people at the imminent launch event (just a few minutes away now) here at Nottingham Trent University (NTU).<br><br>We will be recording key parts of the event and we will make the videos available shortly afterwards. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-15T17:39:43+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Philip Wane</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;2d3c3763.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;ab678f10.1409">   <title>Lectureship in Criminology at the University of Nottingham </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;ab678f10.1409</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>We are currently advertising for a Lecturer in Criminology in the School of Sociology and Social Policy at the University of Nottingham and I would be very grateful if you could bring the details of the post (available at http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/jobs/currentvacancies/ref/SOC240414) to the attention of anyone in your networks you think might be interested in applying. We are particularly keen to attract applicants with expertise in quantitative research methods. I would be happy to have an informal conversation with anyone interested in the post and can be contacted via email (William.dixon@nottingham.ac.uk&lt;mailto:William.dixon@nottingham.ac.uk&gt;) or on the phone number provided below. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-09-18T13:48:11+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>William Dixon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRITSOCCRIM-MIDLANDS-NETWORK;ab678f10.1409</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
